column2: people may sell or lend their property
column3: and other people may buy or borrow it. If one person wants to buy
column4: and another person wants to sell to them
column5: they do not need to get permission from higher power. People can have a market (buying and selling with each other) without anyone else telling them to. People who own capital are sometimes called capitalists (people who support capitalism are called capitalists
column6: too). They can hire anyone who wants to work in their factories
column7: shops or lands for them for the pay they offer.The word capital can be used to mean things that produce more things or money. For example
column11: tools and machines are capital. If someone has money that can be invested
column12: that money is capital too.In capitalist systems
column13: many people are workers (or proletarians). They are employed to earn money for living. People can choose to work for anyone who will hire them in a free market.
